text: :bulb: hubl statement autocomplete
install the vscode extension. (I know you’d rather have it in design manager, but it’s atleast something)
Domain Filter for Simple and Advanced Menus
thats a brilliant idea <@UDW3NP3EX>. As someone who is working on a rebrand, I have def been tripped up by the menus

definitely an interesting idea. could you kinda elaborate a little on how you’re thinking this could work? like is that to filter the links inside of 1 menu, if so what’s the problem you’re trying to solve?
Yes. When you search for the links in your menu (in the dropdown) it pulls up the search results for all the pages inside HubSpot. (page translations or websites for different products, for example)

Our translated pages are set up differently - au.website, ca.website, uk. website, etc. It’s especially difficult to find the correct feature page if they have the same page title (which is technically better for organizational purposes)
I’d post this also to the HubSpot Community Ideas forum and link to it from here, I think you’ll get a fair amount of upvotes
Ok. I posted it to the Community Ideas forum a few days ago - I’ll put the link on here as well. Thanks. :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Domain-Filter-for-Simple-and-Advanced-Menus/idi-p/266771> - Community post for the simple/advanced menu domain filter idea :wink:

It would be nice to have the filename of a selected image next to an image field. I often have to clone a module to test a feature etc. and it isn’t fun digging through the browser dev tools just to find that URL.
That would be handy
But isn't the hunt exciting?
Typical response to me
Did you know that Elmer Fudd is responsible for “Nimrod” being an insult? Bugs Bunny calls him that mockingly because Nimrod is this biblical master hunter.
Huh. Nope. Also I suddenly realize I misspelled his name
Nemrod
Look at that. Loony tunes got religion
HS Community Champions mailed swag idea - Orange Cape with the HubSpot logo on it
